Comments: bytecode is CIL; .NET Core Runtime on GitHub

Languages: interactive web authoring tool. bytecode is named ""ActionScript Byte Code (.abc)""

Implementation language: 15k + 2850 per JIT arch + 500 per host OS

Languages: Features are simplified, usually include assembler, compiler, text-level and binary-level interpreters, sometimes editor, debugger and OS. Compiling speeds are >20 SKLOC/S and behave much like JIT.
Implementation language: 2.8K to 5.6K; advanced, professional implementations are smaller.

Languages: Is an open-source virtual machine designed for executing programs written in Hack and PHP.

Base source code provides both the interpreter as well as an unsupported compile-to-C version. The runtime code, that is shared between the compiler and the interpreter, is written in a variant of C called RTT.
JIT: C, RTT (a custom front-end to C, provided with the base source for Icon).
Implementation language: ~180k total. (source to bytecode: ~11k, bytecode interpreter: ~46k, iconc: ~23k, common/headers: ~13k, rtt: ~15k)

Virtual machine: Java, Kotlin, Jython, Groovy, JRuby, C, C++, Clojure, Scala and several others
Languages: Reference implementation by Sun ; OpenJDK: code under GPL ; IcedTea: code and tools under GPL
JIT: JDK, OpenJDK & IcedTea with regular JIT : Java, C, ASM ; IcedTea with the ""Zero"" JIT : Java, C
Implementation language: JVM is around 6500k lines; TCK is 80k tests and around 1000k lines

Virtual machine: C, C++, Kotlin, Objective-C, Ada, Fortran, and Rust
Languages: MSIL, C and C++ output are supported. ActionScript Byte Code output is supported by Adobe Alchemy. bytecode is named ""LLVM Bytecode (.bc)"". assembly is named ""LLVM Assembly Language (*.ll)"".

Virtual machine: CLI languages including: C#, VB.NET, IronPython, IronRuby, and others

Languages: UCSD Pascal, widespread in late 70s including Apple II

Virtual machine: Perl (6 & 5), NQP-rx, PIR, PASM, PBC, BASIC, bc, C99, ECMAScript, Lisp, Lua, m4, Tcl, WMLScript, XML, and others

Languages: Self-hosting implementation of Python, next generation of Psyco
Virtual machine for another Ruby implementation
A Micro-version of Microsoft .NET Framework to let applications run sandboxed inside browser
Self hosting implementation of Squeak virtual machine. Rich multi-media support.
Checking of memory accesses and leaks under Linux
Virtual machine for small devices, similar to Java
Virtual machine of the reference implementation for Ruby 1.9 and newer versions
